name: Acme-Hardesty - Palmitic Acid (C16)
description: Acme-Hardesty supplies high-purity Palmitic Acid (Hexadecanoic Acid, C16) for barrier repair formulations. Minimum 98% pure palmitic acid is essential for lipid barrier formation and provides emulsification and thickening properties. Several varieties available for different industrial processes including cosmetic applications.
tags.name: Acme-Hardesty - Palmitic Acid C16
tags.description: Acme-Hardesty offers high-purity Palmitic Acid (Hexadecanoic Acid, C16) with minimum 98% purity for cosmetic applications. This essential saturated fatty acid is a critical component of the skin's natural lipid barrier, providing barrier repair, emulsification, and thickening properties. Available in several varieties optimized for different industrial and cosmetic processes.
tags.notes: CAS 57-10-3. Minimum 98% purity ensures high quality for cosmetic applications. Palmitic acid is a critical structural lipid in the skin barrier, comprising approximately 20-25% of stratum corneum lipids. Essential component of ceramide-cholesterol-fatty acid barrier repair systems.

Palmitic acid is essential for the skin's natural lipid barrier and must be present in proper ratios with ceramides and cholesterol (typically 1:1:1) for effective barrier repair. CAS 57-10-3. Multiple varieties available for different formulation needs.
specializations: Several varieties for different industrial processes
tags.notes: Acme-Hardesty offers Palmitic Acid (Hexadecanoic Acid, C16) with minimum 98% purity. Several varieties available for different industrial processes. High purity suitable for cosmetic applications including barrier repair, emulsification, and thickening. CAS: 57-10-3. US-based chemical distributor.
